query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 La concubina di Titone antico 2 già s’imbiancava al balco d’orïente, 3 fuor de le braccia del suo dolce amico;
query.error: **English:** 1 The concubine of ancient Tithonus 2 was already turning white on the balcony of the east, 3 out of the arms of her sweet lover;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 di gemme la sua fronte era lucente, 5 poste in figura del freddo animale 6 che con la coda percuote la gente;
query.error: **English:** 4 her forehead was shining with gems, 5 set in the figure of the cold animal 6 that strikes people with its tail;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 e la notte, de’ passi con che sale, 8 fatti avea due nel loco ov’ eravamo, 9 e ’l terzo già chinava in giuso l’ale;
query.error: **English:** 7 and the night, with the steps with which it ascends, 8 had taken two in the place where we were, 9 and was already lowering its wings for the third;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 quand’ io, che meco avea di quel d’Adamo, 11 vinto dal sonno, in su l’erba inchinai 12 là ’ve già tutti e cinque sedavamo.
query.error: **English:** 10 when I, who had with me some of Adam's nature, 11 overcome by sleep, bowed down on the grass 12 where all five of us were already sitting.
query.result: 10 yadā aham, yaḥ Adhasya aṁśaḥ mama asti, 11 nidrābhibhūtaḥ, tṛṇe praṇipatitaḥ, 12 yatra asmābhiḥ pañcabhiḥ saha upaveśanam kṛtam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 Ne l’ora che comincia i tristi lai 14 la rondinella presso a la mattina, 15 forse a memoria de’ suo’ primi guai,
query.error: **English:** 13 At the hour when the swallow begins its sad songs 14 near the morning, 15 perhaps in memory of its first sorrows,
query.result: 13 Yasmin kāle viṣṇuḥ ārabhate duḥkhitaḥ krandanam 14 śakunir iva prātaḥkāle, 15 kim vā smaraṇāt prathamasya duḥkhasya tasya,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 e che la mente nostra, peregrina 17 più da la carne e men da’ pensier presa, 18 a le sue visïon quasi è divina,
query.error: **English:** 16 and when our mind, a wanderer, 17 less taken by the flesh and more by thoughts, 18 is almost divine in its visions,
query.result: 16 yasmin kāle ca manaḥ asmākam parivrājakam 17 śarīrāt adhikaṃ ca cintāyāṃ nīyamānam, 18 sva-darśaneṣu iva prāyaḥ dṛṣṭiḥ,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 in sogno mi parea veder sospesa 20 un’aguglia nel ciel con penne d’oro, 21 con l’ali aperte e a calare intesa;
query.error: **English:** 19 in a dream I seemed to see suspended 20 an eagle in the sky with golden feathers, 21 with its wings spread and intent on descending;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 ed esser mi parea là dove fuoro 23 abbandonati i suoi da Ganimede, 24 quando fu ratto al sommo consistoro.
query.error: **English:** 22 and I seemed to be where Ganymede's companions were abandoned, 23 when he was snatched up to the highest council.
query.result: 22 atha mayā dṛṣṭaḥ aham iva tatra āsīt yatra 23 Ganymede-anugāmibhiḥ parityaktaḥ āsīt, 24 yadā sa uttama-sabhāyām āhṛtaḥ āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Fra me pensava: ‘Forse questa fiede 26 pur qui per uso, e forse d’altro loco 27 disdegna di portarne suso in piede’.
query.error: **English:** 25 Within myself I thought: ‘Perhaps this she-wolf 26 is here merely by chance, and perhaps from some other place 27 she disdains to carry us up on her back’.
query.result: 25 Madhye mama cintayiṣyāmi: ‘Kim ayam vṛkī 26 Atraiva sthitā syāt prayogāt, vā anyasmāt sthānāt 27 Asmān uccaiḥ pādayoḥ praṇayitum anicchati’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 Poi mi parea che, poi rotata un poco, 29 terribil come folgor discendesse, 30 e me rapisse suso infino al foco.
query.error: **English:** 28 Then it seemed to me that, after I had turned a little, 29 something terrible descended like lightning, 30 and snatched me up to the fire.
query.result: 28 Tataḥ me abhāsat yathā, tataḥ paryāvarttitaḥ alpaśaḥ, 29 ghoraḥ iva vidyud iva avatīrṇam, 30 ca mām ākrāmya ūrdhvam anena agninā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 Ivi parea che ella e io ardesse; 32 e sì lo ’ncendio imaginato cosse, 33 che convenne che ’l sonno si rompesse.
query.error: **English:** 31 There it seemed that she and I were burning; 32 and so the imagined fire consumed me, 33 that it was necessary that my sleep be broken.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 Non altrimenti Achille si riscosse, 35 li occhi svegliati rivolgendo in giro 36 e non sappiendo là dove si fosse,
query.error: **English:** 34 Not otherwise did Achilles rouse himself, 35 turning his awakened eyes around, 36 and not knowing where he was,
query.result: 34 Na anyathā Akhileyaḥ prādurabhavat, 35 jagṛtur nayane parivartayan paritaḥ, 36 na jānann atra kutaḥ syāt,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 quando la madre da Chirón a Schiro 38 trafuggò lui dormendo in le sue braccia, 39 là onde poi li Greci il dipartiro;
query.error: **English:** 37 when his mother, from Chiron at Scyros, 38 spirited him away, while he slept in her arms, 39 from where the Greeks later took him away;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 che mi scoss’ io, sì come da la faccia 41 mi fuggì ’l sonno, e diventa’ ismorto, 42 come fa l’uom che, spaventato, agghiaccia.
query.error: **English:** 40 than I started up, as sleep fled from my face, 41 and I became pale, 42 as a man does who, frightened, turns cold.
query.result: 40 yathā aham prādurabhavam, yathā mukhato me 41 nidrā apajagāma, mṛtavat aham abhūvam, 42 yathā bhavati puruṣaḥ bhayena stambhitena.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 Dallato m’era solo il mio conforto, 44 e ’l sole er’ alto già più che due ore, 45 e ’l viso m’era a la marina torto.
query.error: **English:** 43 On one side only was my comfort, 44 and the sun was already more than two hours high, 45 and my face was turned toward the sea.
query.result: 43 Ekasmin eva diśi āsīt mama āśvāsaḥ, 44 Sūryaś ca āsīt uttungaḥ adhikaṃ dve horā, 45 Mama ca vaktram āsīt samudrasya abhimukham.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 Tu se’ omai al purgatorio giunto: 50 vedi là il balzo che ’l chiude dintorno; 51 vedi l’entrata là ’ve par digiunto.
query.error: **English:** 49 You are now arrived at Purgatory: 50 see there the precipice that encloses it all around; 51 see the entrance there where it seems to be broken off.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 Dianzi, ne l’alba che procede al giorno, 53 quando l’anima tua dentro dormia, 54 sovra li fiori ond’ è là giù addorno
query.error: **English:** 52 Just now, at dawn, which precedes the day, 53 when your soul was sleeping within, 54 over the flowers which adorn that place below,
query.result: 52 Adyaiva, uṣasi yā pūrvaṃ divasasya, 53 yadā tava ātmā antaḥ suṣvāpa, 54 puṣpebhyaḥ adhastād yais tatra śobhā,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 Sordel rimase e l’altre genti forme; 59 ella ti tolse, e come ’l dì fu chiaro, 60 sen venne suso; e io per le sue orme.
query.error: **English:** 58 Sordello remained and the other noble forms; 59 she took you away, and as soon as it was daylight, 60 she came up; and I followed in her footsteps.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 Qui ti posò, ma pria mi dimostraro 62 li occhi suoi belli quella intrata aperta; 63 poi ella e ’l sonno ad una se n’andaro».
query.error: **English:** 61 Here she set me down, but first she showed me 62 her beautiful eyes, that open entrance; 63 then she and sleep went away together.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 A guisa d’uom che ’n dubbio si raccerta 65 e che muta in conforto sua paura, 66 poi che la verità li è discoperta,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 mi cambia’ io; e come sanza cura 68 vide me ’l duca mio, su per lo balzo 69 si mosse, e io di rietro inver’ l’altura.
query.error: **English:** 67 I changed; and when my leader saw me without worry, 68 he moved up the cliff, 69 and I followed him towards the heights.
query.result: 67 tathā aham parivarttitaḥ abhūvam; yathā ca nirbhayaṃ 68 mayā dṛṣṭaḥ mama netā, upari girauḥ 69 prādurbabhūva, aham ca tasya paścāt utsedha-diśi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 Lettor, tu vedi ben com’ io innalzo 71 la mia matera, e però con più arte 72 non ti maravigliar s’io la rincalzo.
query.error: **English:** 70 Reader, you see well how I exalt 71 my subject matter, and therefore do not be surprised 72 if I reinforce it with more artistry.
query.result: 70 Pāṭhaka, tvam api paśyasi katham aham unnamayāmi 71 Mama viṣayam, ata eva adhika kalā-prayogena 72 Na āścaryam yadi aham tam punar api pratiṣṭhāpayāmi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 Noi ci appressammo, ed eravamo in parte 74 che là dove pareami prima rotto, 75 pur come un fesso che muro diparte,

query.result: 73 Āvāṃ samīpamagacchāva, ca āvāṃ āsīva bhāge 74 yatra me pūrvaṃ dṛṣṭam āsīt bhinnam, 75 yathā bhittiṃ vibhajati bhedaḥ,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 vidi una porta, e tre gradi di sotto 77 per gire ad essa, di color diversi, 78 e un portier ch’ancor non facea motto.
query.error: **English:** 76 I saw a gate, and three steps below 77 to go to it, of different colors, 78 and a gatekeeper who still did not speak.
query.result: 76 tadā aham ekam dvāram apaśyam, ca adhastāt tasya trayaḥ padaparikramāḥ 77 tena dvāreṇa gamanāya, vividhair varṇaiḥ, 78 ca ekam dvārapālakam yaḥ adyāpi na avocat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 E come l’occhio più e più v’apersi, 80 vidil seder sovra ’l grado sovrano, 81 tal ne la faccia ch’io non lo soffersi;
query.error: **English:** 79 And as my eyes opened more and more, 80 I saw him seated on the sovereign step, 81 such that in his face I could not bear it;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 e una spada nuda avëa in mano, 83 che reflettëa i raggi sì ver’ noi, 84 ch’io drizzava spesso il viso in vano.
query.error: **English:** 82 and he had a naked sword in his hand, 83 which reflected the rays so towards us, 84 that I often turned my face away in vain.
query.result: 82 tasya kare niravasta khḍgaḥ āsīt, 83 yaḥ asmākam abhimukham kiraṇān prakaṭayati sma, 84 yena aham punaḥ punaḥ mūrdhajaṃ nirarthakaṃ vikṣipāmi sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 «Dite costinci: che volete voi?», 86 cominciò elli a dire, «ov’ è la scorta? 87 Guardate che ’l venir sù non vi nòi».
query.error: **English:** 85 "Tell me now: what do you want?", 86 he began to say, "where is your guide? 87 Beware, lest the ascent harm you."
query.result: 85 "Brutaḥ kathaya: kim icchathaḥ?", 86 ārabhata sa vaktuṃ, "kva gatiḥ? 87 Paśyata yathāgamanaṃ na yuṣmānvinaśyet."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 «Donna del ciel, di queste cose accorta», 89 rispuose ’l mio maestro a lui, «pur dianzi 90 ne disse: “Andate là: quivi è la porta”».
query.error: **English:** 88 "Lady of heaven, wise in these things," 89 my master replied to him, "just now 90 she said to us: 'Go there: there is the gate.'"
query.result: 88 "Devastrī, eṣu viṣayeṣu prajñāvatī," 89 pratyuttaram dadau mama guruḥ tasmai, "idānīm eva 90 asmākam abravīt: 'gacchata tatra: tatra dvāraḥ asti.'"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 «Ed ella i passi vostri in bene avanzi», 92 ricominciò il cortese portinaio: 93 «Venite dunque a’ nostri gradi innanzi».
query.error: **English:** 91 "And may she advance your steps for good," 92 the courteous gatekeeper began again, 93 "Come then before our steps."
query.result: 91 "Tasyāśca śubhārthaṃ padāni yūyaṃ prayacchata", 92 punarārambhām cakāra sādhur dvārapālaḥ, 93 "Tasmāt pūrvaṃ asmākaṃ padaprapañcān āgacchata".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 Là ne venimmo; e lo scaglion primaio 95 bianco marmo era sì pulito e terso, 96 ch’io mi specchiai in esso qual io paio.
query.error: **English:** 94 There we came; and the first step 95 was of white marble so polished and smooth, 96 that I mirrored myself in it as I appear.
query.result: 94 Tatra āgamyāvahe; ca prathamaḥ śreṇiḥ 95 śuklaḥ marmaraḥ āsīt tathā parisphuṭaḥ nirmalaśca, 96 yatra aham ātmānam adarśam yathā aham dṛśye.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 Era il secondo tinto più che perso, 98 d’una petrina ruvida e arsiccia, 99 crepata per lo lungo e per traverso.
query.error: **English:** 97 It was the second [circle] tinged more with the color of the sea, 98 of a rough and scorched sandstone, 99 cracked lengthwise and across.
query.result: 97 Dvitīyaṃ punaḥ samudravarṇādhikaṃ raktam āsīt, 98 aśmamayaṃ kharaṃ ca dagdham iva, 99 dīrghaṃ ca pṛthukam ca viṣamam ca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 Lo terzo, che di sopra s’ammassiccia, 101 porfido mi parea, sì fiammeggiante 102 come sangue che fuor di vena spiccia.
query.error: **English:** 100 The third, which masses up above, 101 seemed to me porphyry, so flaming red 102 as blood that spurts forth from a vein.
query.result: 100 Tṛtīyaḥ, yaḥ upari saṃcayaṃ karoti, 101 porphȳros (śilāviśeṣaḥ) iva me adṛśyata, tathā prajvalitaḥ, 102 yathā raktaṃ yaḥ śirāyāḥ bahiḥ praspandate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 Sovra questo tenëa ambo le piante 104 l’angel di Dio sedendo in su la soglia 105 che mi sembiava pietra di diamante.
query.error: **English:** 103 Upon this threshold both his feet were planted, 104 the angel of God sitting upon the threshold, 105 which to me seemed to be a diamond rock.
query.result: 103 Asmin simhāsane ubhe pādāv āstām 104 Devasya dūtasya sīmni nīvīne 105 Yo mayā hīramayaḥ śilāmayaḥ iva adṛśyata.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 Per li tre gradi sù di buona voglia 107 mi trasse il duca mio, dicendo: «Chiedi 108 umilemente che ’l serrame scioglia».
query.error: **English:** 106 Up the three steps with good will 107 my leader drew me, saying: "Ask 108 humbly that he unbolt the lock."
query.result: 106 Triṣu śreṇīṣu samyakmanasā 107 Mām ākarṣat patir mama, vadan: "Yāca 108 Vinayena yathā sa bandhanam vimokṣayet."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Divoto mi gittai a’ santi piedi; 110 misericordia chiesi e ch’el m’aprisse, 111 ma tre volte nel petto pria mi diedi.
query.error: **English:** 109 Devoutly I threw myself at the holy feet; 110 I asked for mercy and for him to open up to me, 111 but three times I struck myself in the chest first.
query.result: 109 Bhaktyāham papātaṃ pādau śubhau, 110 Kṛpāṃ yācito ’smīti tad-dvāra-mokṣaṇam, 111 Tathāpi triḥ pṛṣṭhe ’haṃ prāharāṃcakāra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 Sette P ne la fronte mi descrisse 113 col punton de la spada, e «Fa che lavi, 114 quando se’ dentro, queste piaghe» disse.
query.error: **English:** 112 Seven P's he inscribed on my forehead 113 with the point of his sword, and said, "Make sure you wash 114 these wounds when you are inside."
query.result: 112 Sapta P ne la fronte mi descrisse 113 Kṣurasya agreṇa, evaṃ ca āha, "Tvaṃ praviṣṭaḥ satī, 114 Imāni vraṇāni praksālaya."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 Cenere, o terra che secca si cavi, 116 d’un color fora col suo vestimento; 117 e di sotto da quel trasse due chiavi.
query.error: **English:** 115 Ashes, or earth dug up dry, 116 would be of a color with his raiment; 117 and from beneath it he drew forth two keys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 L’una era d’oro e l’altra era d’argento; 119 pria con la bianca e poscia con la gialla 120 fece a la porta sì, ch’i’ fu’ contento.
query.error: **English:** 118 One was of gold and the other was of silver; 119 first with the white and then with the yellow 120 he did so to the gate that I was content.
query.result: 118 Ekā svarṇamayī āsid anyā rajatī ca, 119 pūrvam śuklena paścāt pītena ca 120 tathā dvāram akarod yathā aham santuṣṭaḥ abhūvam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 «Quandunque l’una d’este chiavi falla, 122 che non si volga dritta per la toppa», 123 diss’ elli a noi, «non s’apre questa calla.
query.error: **English:** 121 "Whenever one of these keys fails, 122 so that it does not turn straight in the lock," 123 he said to us, "this passage does not open.
query.result: 121 Yadaikāpyetāsāṃ mukhyāṃ na pravartate, 122 Yathā na ṛjuvartate dvāre, 123 Ityabravidasmākam, naivayam gatiḥ prasīdati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 Più cara è l’una; ma l’altra vuol troppa 125 d’arte e d’ingegno avanti che diserri, 126 perch’ ella è quella che ’l nodo digroppa.
query.error: **English:** 124 One is dearer; but the other requires 125 much art and skill before it will unlock, 126 for it is the one that ties the knot.
query.result: 124 Ekā priyatara; anyā tu bahu 125 kalāṃ prajñām ca pūrvam icchati, 126 yataḥ sā granthim bandhati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 Da Pier le tegno; e dissemi ch’i’ erri 128 anzi ad aprir ch’a tenerla serrata, 129 pur che la gente a’ piedi mi s’atterri».
query.error: **English:** 127 From Peter he took the keys; and said to me that I was 128 rather to open than to keep it locked, 129 even if the people should fall down at my feet.
query.result: 127 Pitrāc ca sañjñāṃ gṛhītvā, aha ca mama, "Tvam eva 128 udghāṭanāya, na tu pidhānanāya, 129 api janānām pādayoḥ patanānām api."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Poi pinse l’uscio a la porta sacrata, 131 dicendo: «Intrate; ma facciovi accorti 132 che di fuor torna chi ’n dietro si guata».
query.error: **English:** 130 Then he considered the door to the sacred gate, 131 saying: "Enter; but I warn you 132 that whoever looks back turns away from it."
query.result: 130 Tataḥ sa vicintayat dvāram tatra pavitrasya, 131 uktavantaḥ: "Praviśata; aham ca kartavyam jānāmi 132 yaḥ paścād avalokayati sa bahiḥ pratyāvartate."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 E quando fuor ne’ cardini distorti 134 li spigoli di quella regge sacra, 135 che di metallo son sonanti e forti,
query.error: **English:** 133 And when outside, on the twisted hinges, 134 the corners of that sacred barrier, 135 which are of metal, resounding and strong,
query.result: 133 Tataśca bahiḥ vikṛtiṣu kakṣeṣu 134 aṅgulīni tasyāḥ pṛthivyāḥ pavitrasya, 135 yāni dhatulohāni dhvanitāni ca dṛḍhāni ca,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 non rugghiò sì né si mostrò sì acra 137 Tarpëa, come tolto le fu il buono 138 Metello, per che poi rimase macra.
query.error: **English:** 136 did not roar so or show itself so fierce 137 Tarpeia, when the good Metellus was taken from her, 138 because of which she then remained lean.
query.result: 136 na raurova iva na ca prakāśita iva tathā 137 Tārpeya, yadā tasyāḥ śreṣṭhaḥ Metellus apahṛtaḥ āsīt, 138 yena tato'sau kṛśāvasthitā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
139 Io mi rivolsi attento al primo tuono, 140 e ‘Te Deum laudamus’ mi parea 141 udire in voce mista al dolce suono.
query.error: **English:** 139 I turned attentively to the first thunderclap, 140 and it seemed to me that I heard 141 “Te Deum laudamus” mixed with the sweet sound.
query.result: 139 Prathama evaitanitāntam ahanidrāvaṇam śrutvā, 140 “Te Deum laudamus” iti madhuraśabdamilito yaḥ śabdaḥ, 141 sa eva me śravaṇe patitaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
142 Tale imagine a punto mi rendea 143 ciò ch’io udiva, qual prender si suole 144 quando a cantar con organi si stea;
query.error: **English:** 142 Such an image made me recall 143 what I heard, as one is wont to do 144 when one stands listening to organs;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
145 ch’or sì or no s’intendon le parole.
query.error: **English:** 145 for now the words are understood, now not.
query.result: 145 kadācit śabdaḥ śrūyate, kadācit na śrūyate.
